Steps.Message: Good morning, this is a message from Ryan at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut that is scheduled for today the 3rd of February 2026 in the IP25 postcode area. Our engineers have advised us that unfortunately there is going to be a delay in the power being switched off. This is due to safety checks within some properties and on the network taking longer than expected. We now estimate to switch off power to the area in stages by approximately 10:00. Our reference number for this work is INCD-17281-I. We would like to apologise for any inconvenience this may cause you. If you have any questions or you have moved from the IP25 postcode area, then please call 105.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified cables and 6 poles that need replacing and upgrading. We will also be carrying out some tree trimming. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our engineers may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. This work is taking place in Shipdham Road in Carbrooke. A road closure will be in place to allow the work to be carried out safely.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Cromer Hyde Lane.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 02:48 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers diverted power around the underground network fault in the Lower Road area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 2 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry we've not been able to restore your power yet. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we're still aiming to have power restored as soon as possible.

If you light candles, please be mindful of them and take extra care when using the stairs. If you have any concerns, please call us on 105 and our team will help. We'll keep you updated. Sent by Aaron at 00:54
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Aaron at 23:35 - Thanks for bearing with us over today, I just wanted to give you the latest from our engineers. Our staff have now confirmed that our substation equipment has operated due to an underground cable fault which we'll need to pinpoint, excavate and repair. We have further specialist teams and equipment on site and it's possible they will still be able to restore your power within the current time frame using other methods. However, once they've assessed further we'll let you know if the time frame needs to change. For more information about this type of fault; here's a short video https://bit.ly/2ScxQDZ - I'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent at 17:10 by Aaron - More electricity has been restored thanks to our ground team's continued work, and the lights are now safely back on to further properties.

If your electricity has come back on now, or does so at any time in the future, simply click this link to stop receiving our SMS updates: bit.ly/348KOZ3.

Sent by Aaron at 16:07 - Just a quick update to let you know our temporary generator has arrived and engineers are in the process of connecting it. The power may come back on to your area in stages.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 03:30 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers repaired a fault on the underground network in the Danson Road area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage and how long you were off for. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 01:32 - We want to reassure you that we've certainly not forgotten about you and we know that the estimated time frame has now passed. Getting you an update is our priority, as we know it's important that you have the latest information.

Our team on site are still working, and we are liaising with them to get a progress update to you as soon as we can safely do so. As soon as we hear from them we'll be in touch, or you can call us on 105 if you need any additional support.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We know the time frame we initially estimated is now approaching. Our engineers are continuing their work to repair our underground network in the Danson Road area.

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Theo at 00:44.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 12:00 - Our digging team are progressing well with excavations to expose our cabling so repairs can begin. Excavations can sometimes take longer than expected, depending on ground conditions, other utility equipment like gas and water pipes, parked vehicles, or local traffic.

At the moment our estimated time frame of 16:00-17:00 hasn't changed, but as our staff are busy working with live electricity we need to wait until they can safely stop work and contact us with the latest information. Once they do, we'll update you further.

Our team are always here if you have any questions.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 11:03 - Hi David here again. Our engineers have just advised us that they are now estimating to have power restored between 16:00 and 17:00 due to a lot of work still to do to dig down and locate the faulty underground electrical equipment before they can work to restore the power the Broadoaks Way area.

If you have a vulnerable person at home, please call us on 08003163105 and we'll see if we can provide any additional support.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 10:52 - Hi David here again. I'm so sorry power is still off this morning. Just to let you know. I'm so sorry i cant give you an estimated timeframe at present as we are still awaiting for the engineers to advise us of when they believe power will be restored. We're sorry for the disruption this power cut may be causing. If you're worried about elderly or ill neighbours, we can offer help and support to our vulnerable customers during a power cut. Find out more here: https://UKPN.short.gy/PSR. If you have any concerns, please call us on 08003163105

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 10:33 - We can now confirm that all power in the Southwold Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with a piece of overhead network equipment, which our engineers have replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Simon at 09:52 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://UKPN.short.gy/PSR If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Simon at 09:13 - Thanks for your patience over today; I'll be on hand to update you as our staff work on repairs, and I just wanted to give you the latest from site. We can now confirm that a fault on our overhead network in the Southwold Road area is causing safety equipment on our network to operate. Although we know what's causing your power cut, we still need to locate the fault. To do this we've sent specialist teams and equipment, once they have been able to assess the network we'll be able to advise a new estimated time frame for the repair. For more information about this type of fault; here's a short video https://bit.ly/3cVaivc.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We had to turn off your power so our engineers can safely carry out essential maintenance.
PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We have repaired the problem with the electricity supply in your area. There may still be some tidying up to do, and any details have been passed to our Maintenance department, who will attend to it as soon as possible. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 12:20 - Hi David here again. Thanks for your patience over today.

Our engineers have let us know that they have run into complications with the ongoing repairs to the faulty overhead electrical equipment which is hindering our progress to restore your power. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 15:30 and 16:30.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 12:11 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://UKPN.short.gy/PSR If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 11:13 - Hi David here again. I just wanted to let you know that our engineers now believe the unplanned issue is due to a faulty piece of overhead electrical equipment on the High Voltage network which they are investigating and looking at ways of restoring the power to the Street area. At the moment we didn't need to change the estimated timeframe. We're sorry for the disruption this power cut may be causing. If you're worried about elderly or ill neighbours, we can offer help and support to our vulnerable customers during a power cut. Find out more here: https://UKPN.short.gy/PSR. If you have any concerns, please call us on 08003163105
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 09:43. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Link Road area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of 15:30-16:30 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Simon at 12:17.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 12:04 - We're sorry your power has gone off again. We are sending our engineers back to the Link Road area to investigate why.

Currently, our time frame for power to be restored is between 15:30 and 16:30, but once our staff arrive on site and assess the situation, this time may change. As there have been other power cuts recently it's difficult to know what repairs will be needed to restore your power safely, so time frames we provide throughout have to be estimated.

The results of our engineer's tests on our network will let us know if our estimate needs to be adjusted, so we'll update you as soon as they have arrived on site and investigated.
